page.title: 03CROPWELL BUTLER VILLAGE HALL
page.content: This was converted from a school building in 1970. It is sited in the centre of the village with gardens, playground & car-park. Facilities include large hall with stage, two smaller rooms, kitchen and cloakrooms. A caretaker & gardener are employed. It is the centre of public administr- ation, a polling station for elections & a valued social centre. The trustees are the Parish Council but administr- ation is the responsibility of an elected Management Committee which meets monthly. The present committee represents Parish Council, Tithby, the Churches, Young Farmers Club, Women's Institute, Youth Club, Playgroup, & the Botiller Players, plus 6 elected & 1 co-opted member. Costs are met by letting the Hall, & by holding fund raising events. A monthly Newsletter informs the Village of all activities.
